Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2012 06:15PM Jeaner wrote: 45 yo too and was found to have a 7mm spiculated mass in my breast this week.  Later that morning I had a biopsy and the radiologist believed she got the area.  Pathology comes back today stating no malignancy however my doctor tells me she believes they didn't get the area and another attempt needs to be made.  I am opting for a wire guided biopsy this time.  Everyone has been trying to act chipper but the look on their faces tell me otherwise.  I am freaking out inside and feeling like I'm in a daze.  My mother was diagnosed at 45 and had a double mastectomy, no chemo or radiation and is doing great today.  Two of my dad's sisters died from breast cancer.  I have two boys and like you worry about them.  I'm trying to keep calm around family and process everything.  I can't tell my mother because she'll be devastated.  My brother died of cancer in 97 and since freaks out about any little thing.  From what I've read spiculated masses have a high probability of being malignant.  I keep getting told how it's good that it was caught at this size, too.  Feeling a bit bipolar....acting like it's not a big deal and then feeling like crying the next minute.  This sucks.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang
